questions.question: Which is the Upper Chamber of State Legislature in India?
In any State of India, Legislative Council can be created or can be abolished by
options: A. The President on the recommendation of the Governor of the State
C. The Parliament as per Resolution passed by the Legislative Assembly of the State
D. The Governor on the recommendation of the Council of Ministers
questions.answer: C. The Parliament as per Resolution passed by the Legislative Assembly of the State

questions.question: The provisions for creation and abolition of Legislative Councils in any State is included in Indian Constitution under
Who conducts the State Assembly Elections?
options: A. Chief Justice of High Court

questions.question: Who among the following is the final authority to decide any question relating to disqualification of a Member of a House of Legislature of a State?
options: B. Speaker of the Legislative Assembly

questions.question: The „Contingency Fund‟ of the State is operated by
options: A. The Governor of the State
B. The Chief Minister of the State

questions.question: Who is the head of the government of the state?
A person who is not a member of the state legislature can be appointed Chief Minister for how many months?
Who administers the oath of Chief Minister?
options: D. Chief Justice of concerned High Court

questions.question: Which one of the following statements about the Chief Minister of a State is NOT CORRECT?
options: A. The Chief Minister is appointed by the Governor
B. The Chief Minister generally presides over the Cabinet Meetings
C. The Governor has to exercise all his functions on the advice of the Chief Minister
D. Ministers are appointed by the Governor on the advice of the Chief Minister
questions.answer: C. The Governor has to exercise all his functions on the advice of the Chief Minister
